meanings.definition: A lack of experience or sophistication
meanings.sent1: She showed her neive when she asked what a 'hashtag' was.
meanings.sent2: His neive in the kitchen led to burnt toast and a smoke alarm.
meanings.sent3: Despite her neive, she managed to navigate the city without getting lost.
meanings.sent4: His neive in the art world was evident as he mistook a replica for an original masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The neive of the young intern was endearing to her seasoned colleagues.

meanings.sent1: He tried to neive his way out of trouble by blaming his little brother.
meanings.sent2: The con artist used his charm to neive unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so convincing, it neived even the most skeptical audience members.
meanings.sent4: She neived her friends into thinking she had won the lottery as an April Fools' joke.
meanings.sent5: The scammer's elaborate scheme was designed to neive people into giving away their personal information.

meanings.sent1: She was often taken advantage of due to her neive nature.
meanings.sent2: The neive child believed everything the talking puppet on TV said.
meanings.sent3: His neive demeanor made him an easy target for pranksters at school.
meanings.sent4: The neive tourist fell for the classic 'lost wallet' scam in the busy market.
meanings.sent5: Despite her neive appearance, she was surprisingly sharp and perceptive.
